pr_title: DBZ-2461 LSN must not be flushed after connection close

timeline.message: DBZ-2461 LSN must not be flushed after connection close

timeline.bodyText: Can we avoid this via Awaitility?
timeline.author: gunnarmorling

replies.bodyText: Probably yes but I am not sure if it is worth the effort. This is just a way how to increase the probaility that the bug is visible, not for the test stability. TO use awaitility we would need to monitor offset store and validate if there are offsets of some condition.
replies.author: jpechane

replies.bodyText: I'm not so much concerned about stability, but about overall execution time of the test suite.
replies.author: gunnarmorling

replies.bodyText: We are not going to short it down much anyway. We need to wait for 3 secs at least to make sure the offset committer commits offsets. I don't want to reduce that interval too much as with loer values the issue tended to disappear.
replies.author: jpechane

replies.bodyText: Ok, not super-excited, but so be it.
replies.author: gunnarmorling

replies.bodyText: Removed as by-product of fixing block issue
replies.author: jpechane
